title: help identifying a typeface
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021354im_/http:/typophile.com/files/secession_3595.jpg)

This is from Typology, by Heller & Fili. It’s a French Art Nouveau typeface, listed as ’Secession’, by an unknown designer. Is there a modern facsimile, something that looks reasonably close? The rounded feel is what I find really attractive, and Indentifont was drawing blanks for me...
author: Brian Watson

comments.content:
This is something similar:

[Scholz Secession](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021354/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/hihretrofonts/scholz-secession/regular/)

—- Tamas Ferencz —-
Philippe says: » [Pumpernix by Dixies Delight](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021354/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=45144).« Flies around as a freefont.
BTW, the forum-rules say: See FAQ #2: Please use a [descriptive title for your posting](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021354/http:/typophile.com/forum/typeid/faq/#Q_2) next time.
Thanks to both Atwe and Renko.
